name: censer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a container for incense (= a substance that is burned to produce a sweet smell, especially as part of a religious ceremony): A priest began walking through the congregation swinging a censer.
Kattiyaearn/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe drawings show changing styles of prehistoric censers in the Mayan era.In the temple censers burned, filling the air with fragrant haze.During the Mass, the litanies and prayers, the censers swinging to and fro and the smell of incense made her feel lightheaded.She placed a palmful of incense into the censer and lit it.The chest contained a silver censer, an ivory and gold cross, two silver candelabra, and two gospel books in gold and silver.
